meanings.definition: To train (an animal) to defecate and urinate in a designated place indoors.
meanings.sent1: I housetrain my puppy to use the pee pads.
meanings.sent2: She successfully housetrained her kitten to use the litter box.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was funny to housetrain the dog to use the toilet.
meanings.sent4: He managed to housetrain the parrot to only poop in its cage.
meanings.sent5: Housetraining the hamster proved to be a challenging but rewarding task.

meanings.definition: To train (a person) to follow rules or guidelines for behavior within a household.
meanings.sent1: Parents housetrain their children to pick up after themselves.
meanings.sent2: It is important to housetrain new roommates on shared responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The siblings decided to housetrain each other on how to do chores with a fun game.
meanings.sent4: She housetrained her partner to always put the dishes in the dishwasher.
meanings.sent5: Housetraining employees on office etiquette is crucial for a harmonious workplace.
